alert.note: Alert for North Big Horn Basin; Owl Creek and Bridger Mountains; Southeast Big Horn Basin; Southwest Big Horn Basin (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 21 at 3:00AM MST until February 21 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Occasional snow, mainly light. Significant blowing snow possible in locations that received over an inch of snow overnight. Winds gusting as high as 40 to 50 mph. * WHERE...Bighorn Basin and the Owl Creek and Bridger Mountains. * WHEN...Now until 5 PM today. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Blowing snow will sharply reduce visibility at times. Wind chills as low as 20 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: North Big Horn Basin; Owl Creek and Bridger Mountains; Southeast Big Horn Basin; Southwest Big Horn Basin
